availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edward Bumpass (Webster County, Ky, farmer and pvt 35th Ky Mtd Inf)

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Nancy C. Bumpass. Father of Alpha A. E. Bumpass, William B. Bumpass, and Eliza A. Bumpass. Farmer in Webster County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 35th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 2, 1863, to December 29, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 599.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0413.
